intro: Mulgedium divaricatum, commonly known as the variable mulgedium, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters during the summer months, which are followed by small, spherical fruits. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and have a slightly serrated edge. Mulgedium divaricatum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and stream banks.
